webseo.fea-text-1: We identify and select the keywords (or phrases) that users use to search for content similar to what you propose. The keywords found are divided into generic onea (broad keywords) or more specific (long-tail keywords), and offer different opportunities and advantages in terms of potential traffic. From the beginning, it is important to be clear about the goals of the website or SEO campaign by analyzing the target audience, the products or services offered, and the actions you want users to take on the site. SEO is an ongoing process, and keyword optimization must be regularly updated to adapt to changes in the market and user behavior.
webseo.fea-text-2: The main goal is to create content that is both relevant and useful to users and search engines. This will achieve the goal of increasing qualified traffic to our Web site or portal. It is necessary to write quality, original and in-depth content, respecting the logical structure of the content and taking advantage of the keywords found in the previous analysis. SEO text optimization requires a combination of careful keyword research, quality content creation, and attention to technical and structural details. Following these best practices can help improve your website's visibility in search engines, attract more traffic, and provide a better user experience.
webseo.fea-text-3: There are multiple aspects that contribute to SEO performance, some strategies include reducing loading time, improving user experience (User Experience), content quality (see previous points), technical SEO optimization (meta tags, XML sitemap...). SEO performance needs a holistic approach and it is important to adopt a continuous improvement process, constantly monitoring results and adapting the strategy according to changes in search engines and user behavior.
webseo.fea-text-4: Analyzing SEO results is a key process for understanding how optimization strategies are performing and what adjustments are needed for further improvement. Monitoring and analyzing results allows you to identify areas of success and opportunities for improvement, helping you optimize your website to achieve desired goals. Creating regular reports helps track progress and present results to stakeholders. Key reports include: keyword reports (their ranking before and after the intervention), the organic traffic report (which reports trends in non-paying traffic), and the conversion trend report.

webseo.more-text-1: Search engine optimization (SEO) is a set of strategies and techniques used to improve the visibility of a website in the organic (non-paid) results of search engines such as Google, Bing, and Yahoo. The main goal of SEO is to increase the quantity and quality of traffic to a website by improving its ranking in search engine results pages (SERPs). SEO is important because it helps search engines better understand a website's content, thereby improving its visibility in search results for relevant keywords. Increasing organic visibility means attracting more potential visitors without having to pay for advertising
webseo.more-title-2: What are the goals of SEO?
webseo.more-text-2: The goals of SEO can vary depending on the specific needs of a Web site or business, but in general, the main goals of SEO are to increase visibility in search engines; generate quality organic traffic; improve User Experience (UX); increase conversion rate, increase Site authority.
webseo.more-title-3: What are the benefits of SEO?
webseo.more-text-3: Some of the main benefits of SEO include: improved visibility (a well-optimized site will appear among the top results when users search for related information); sustainable traffic growth (unlike paid advertising, SEO generates organic traffic that can last over time); and increased credibility and trust (users tend to trust organic results more than paid ads). SEO offers numerous benefits, making it an essential component of any digital marketing strategy. From increasing organic traffic to building Brand authority to optimizing the user experience, SEO contributes to the long-term success of a website and business. Investing in SEO means building a solid online foundation that can bring lasting and sustainable results over time.
webseo.more-text-4: SEO guidelines for 2025 reflect the evolution of search engines, user behaviors, and emerging technologies. To be effective, SEO strategies must adapt to these changes, while always keeping the user experience at the center. Here are the key SEO guidelines for 2025: focus on Quality; Core Web Vitals; Local SEO and personalization; video and multimedia content; semantic optimization; structured data; and advanced technical SEO. In 2025, SEO guidelines will require a more holistic approach, integrating technical, content, and user experience aspects. Keeping the site up-to-date with the latest trends, technologies, and user expectations will be critical to success in SEO. Adapting to changes and a user-focused approach will always be key.
webseo.more-title-5: How to check the SEO of a site?
webseo.more-text-5: To check the SEO of a website, there are several steps that can be followed. SEO on Page analysis: which examines the quality of the elements present in the site code (titles, metatags, headings, keywords...). General technical analysis: to check the speed of the site, usability (including on mobile devices)...Backlinks and domain authority: how many external links are pointing to our site, what is the authority recognised to our portal.The quality and relevance of the content of our portal (originality, update rate...).

responsive-web-design.title: Don't make me ZOOM!
responsive-web-design.subtitle:
Practical reasons for having a
RESPONSIVE website.
responsive-web-design.img-responsive: A website with responsive layout to fit all devices
responsive-web-design.cta-2: Contact us now by phone or Whatsapp
responsive-web-design.cta-email: Send an email to the address:
responsive-web-design.fea-text-1: A responsive site automatically adapts to different screen sizes and resolutions, making the user experience optimal on mobile devices, tablets, laptops, and desktops. This increases accessibility and ensures optimal navigation for all users.
responsive-web-design.fea-text-2: Search engines favor responsive sites: a site that adapts well to mobile devices tends to rank better in search results, increasing visibility and organic traffic.
responsive-web-design.fea-text-3: Responsive sites can be optimized to load quickly on mobile devices, where speed is critical to maintain user attention and prevent abandonment.
responsive-web-design.fea-text-4: If a site is not easily navigable from mobile devices, users are more likely to abandon it quickly, increasing the bounce rate. A responsive site keeps users on the site longer, improving engagement.

responsive-web-design.img-more: An example of a web page that adapts to different devices while remaining easily usable by the end user
responsive-web-design.img-more-caption: An optimised web page enables efficient use on different devices
responsive-web-design.more-title-1: What is meant by responsive design?
responsive-web-design.more-text-1: Responsive design is an approach to website design that aims to create pages that automatically adapt to different devices and screen sizes, such as smartphones, tablets, laptops and desktops. The goal is to ensure that the site content is easily readable and navigable, regardless of the screen size or device used.
responsive-web-design.more-title-2: How to make the site responsive?
responsive-web-design.more-text-2: A responsive website utilises techniques such as: fluid layout: the size of page elements, such as images and text columns, resize proportionally according to the width of the screen; media queries: these CSS rules allow specific styles to be applied according to device characteristics; flexible images: images are resized and optimised to fit the screen, improving the user experience and reducing loading times; navigation adaptation: navigation menus are modified to fit smaller screens.
responsive-web-design.more-title-3: What is one of the main advantages of responsive design?
responsive-web-design.more-text-3: One of the main advantages of responsive design is the best user experience on any device. Regardless of whether the user is using a smartphone, tablet or desktop computer, the website will optimally adapt to the screen size and device characteristics.

behind!
web-accessibility.subtitle:

a Web site accessible to all
web-accessibility.img-accessibility: An open padlock symbolizes greater accessibility
web-accessibility.step1: We analyze your site to identify Accessibility issues
web-accessibility.fea-title-1: We analyze and evaluate your Accessibility
web-accessibility.fea-text-1: Assessing the accessibility of a Web site is a key step in making sure that all users, regardless of their abilities, can access the content. With this in mind, the main reference is the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), which provide three levels of compliance: A (minimum); AA (intermediate); and AAA (maximum).
web-accessibility.fea-text-2: Web accessibility regulations vary by country, but many are based on international standards such as the WCAG mentioned in the previous point. In Europe, the main Accessibility legislation is the European Accessibility Act (EU Directive 2019/882), which aims to improve the Accessibility of digital products and services throughout the European Union by 2025. This directive requires that various services and products, including websites, be accessible to people with disabilities, generally following WCAG 2.1 Level AA. In Italy, Law 4/2004, known as the Stanca Law, regulates the accessibility of public administration Web sites. This law applies to all public administrations, public agencies, utility companies, and companies that offer online services to end customers
web-accessibility.fea-text-3: The European Accessibility Act, mentioned in the previous point, requires companies to make their site fully accessible by June 28, 2025. Excluded from this application remain micro-businesses, companies with fewer than 10 employees and annual sales not exceeding 2 million euros. Stakeholders will be required to submit an annual Accessibility Statement in which they publicly declare the accessibility status of their Web site or mobile application.
web-accessibility.fea-title-4: The practical benefits of an accessible site
web-accessibility.fea-text-4: An accessible Web site offers many practical benefits, both for the company or organization that runs it and for users. An accessible site makes it possible to reach people with visual, hearing, motor, or cognitive disabilities who might otherwise have difficulty interacting with a non-optimized site. It is estimated that about 15 percent of the world's population lives with some form of disability. With this in mind, making the site accessible broadens the potential user base. Many of the principles of accessibility, such as proper use of alternative text for images, optimization of titles, and clear page structure, also help search engines better understand the site's content. In addition, an accessible site tends to be easier to use for everyone, not just people with disabilities.

web-accessibility.more-main-subtitle: Features and accessibility requirements for the year 2025
web-accessibility.img-more: Many people are afflicted with some kind of disability: accessible software can mitigate this condition of theirs
web-accessibility.img-more-caption: An affordable product always has a positive impact on the people who use it
web-accessibility.more-text-1: Web accessibility refers to the practice of designing and developing Web sites so that they are usable by everyone, regardless of their physical, cognitive, or technical abilities. The main goal is to ensure that people with disabilities can access content, navigate sites, and interact with information and functionality without encountering barriers.
web-accessibility.more-text-2:
In general, all websites should be accessible to ensure an inclusive experience for all people, including those with disabilities. However, there are some areas where accessibility is particularly important or at least, mandatory. Here are some categories...

  • Government sites: public administration sites must be accessible by Law in most countries (in Europe Directive 2016/2102 applies, in the USA Section 508).
  • Public service sites: sites related to transport, health, education and other essential services must provide access for all.
  • E-commerce sites: accessibility is a crucial factor in enabling all people, including those with disabilities, to shop online.
  • Entertainment sites: sites that offer multimedia content must ensure that this content is also usable by people with sensory or motor disabilities.
  • Education and training sites: e-learning platforms and sites of schools and universities must be accessible to ensure equal learning opportunities for all students.
  • Sites of non-profit organisations: these sites should be accessible to promote inclusion and reach all members of society.
web-accessibility.more-title-3: How to optimize the Accessibility of a Web site?
web-accessibility.more-text-3:
Optimizing the accessibility of a website requires a series of actions that improve the browsing experience for all users, including those with disabilities.
The guidelines mainly suggest that:
1. text and graphic elements should be easily readable for all users, including those with visual impairments or color blindness;
2. the site should be fully navigable using only the keyboard, since some people cannot use a mouse;
3. forms should be accessible and clear; 4. you need to make sure that the user interface is consistent throughout the site...
More generally, a clear and predictable design helps people with cognitive disabilities navigate more easily.
web-accessibility.more-title-4: What are the 4 principles of Accessibility?
web-accessibility.more-text-4: Web accessibility is based on four basic principles established by the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). To be accessible, a site must be perceptible: information and user interface components must be presented in a way that users can perceive them (contrasts, alternative text...). A site must be usable: interface components and navigation must be easily usable by all users (navigability via keyboard or alternative devices to the mouse). The third principle refers to comprehension: the information and operation of the user interface must be understandable (clear text, unambiguous error messages...). Finally, the last principle relates to robustness: content must be robust enough to be interpreted by a wide range of user agents, including assistive devices (semantically valid and well-structured HTML and CSS).

web-sustainability.title: Is your website SUSTAINABLE?
web-sustainability.subtitle: Check your web project's ecological footprint
web-sustainability.cta-title: Contact us today to get a free analysis
web-sustainability.cta-2: Contact us now by phone or Whatsapp
web-sustainability.cta-email: Send an email to the address:
web-sustainability.fea-text-1: The sustainable web reduces the carbon footprint by optimizing the use of digital resources and improving the energy efficiency of web technologies. Reducing the weight and energy required to maintain and access a website lowers the web's carbon footprint, contributing to a more sustainable digital ecosystem.
web-sustainability.fea-text-2: The sustainable web also contributes to the reduction of energy costs through reduced power consumption in data centers, improved efficiency of data traffic, through lighter and faster website development, and better hardware lifecycle management
web-sustainability.fea-text-3: A sustainable website can improve search engine rankings through several factors related to performance optimization and user experience, loading speed, improved user experience (UX), mobile-first approach and increased reputation score all contribute to improving several technical and user experience aspects that positively influence SEO and search engine rankings.
web-sustainability.fea-text-4: Adopting sustainable web practices can significantly enhance corporate reputation as more and more consumers and business partners appreciate a commitment to sustainability. Demonstrating that you have a sustainable website, optimized to reduce your carbon footprint, conveys the image of an environmentally conscious company. A sustainable web can be a differentiator in the industry, providing a competitive advantage over competitors who have not yet embarked on this path. Investors and business partners are increasingly attentive to ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) practices. A concrete commitment to a more sustainable web shows that the company is acting in line with these values, improving the chances of attracting funding or partnerships.

fitp.text-1: From Idea to Prototype, we support you in realizing your project by turning it into a concrete and functional solution. We offer design and development help for software and hardware products. We work with you ensuring performance, usability and accessibility.
fitp.text-2: Every great product starts with a great idea. We work with you through the key stages of the product life cycle, from initial design to delivery of the first working prototype. We collaborate to define requirements, design optimal solutions, and turn your idea into reality. We work in Agile mode: at each iteration we present, ready for acceptance testing, a usable prototype. So on until the finished product is achieved.
fitp.text-3: Design is an essential component in creating an innovative and functional product. We also address aesthetics and user experience-the ultimate goal is to ensure a balance between form and function. Together we create solutions that are not only efficient but also aesthetically pleasing and intuitive to use. From the earliest stages of development, our integrated approach to design ensures a product that is consistent with your vision and optimized for user needs.
fitp.text-4: Il firmware è il cuore che alimenta i tuoi dispositivi hardware. Ci occupiamo dello sviluppo di firmware su misura per garantire che ogni componente del prodotto funzioni in modo efficiente e sicuro. Dal controllo delle periferiche alla gestione delle comunicazioni, progettiamo soluzioni firmware ottimizzate per le esigenze specifiche del tuo progetto, assicurandoci che il prototipo sia completamente funzionante e pronto per l'integrazione con hardware e software.
fitp.text-5: Each product requires the design and implementation of hardware components tailored to meet the specific needs of the project. We work closely with you to ensure that every part of the final product meets your specifications and expectations in order to achieve a reliable, complete, market-ready solution.
fitp.text-6: The back end is the backbone of any application and ensures that all functionality and data are managed efficiently. We handle the development of customized back end solutions, designing scalable, robust and secure architectures that support the needs of your product and your customers. From database management to integration with external systems, we work to ensure that every aspect of the back end runs smoothly and enables a smooth, high-performance user experience.
fitp.text-7: The front end is the face of your product: it is the interface that users see and interact with. Our efforts are aimed at creating an engaging and intuitive user experience. We design attractive and functional graphical user interfaces using the latest technologies and best practices to ensure that every interaction is smooth and enjoyable. From user interface (UI) to user experience (UX), we ensure that your product not only works well, but is also aesthetically pleasing and easy to use for all categories of users.
fitp.text-8:
We offer a range of innovative services.

Design System: we create a comprehensive design system to ensure visual and functional consistency across all interfaces (digital and non-digital).

API: we design and implement APIs (Application Program Interfaces) to enable integration with other applications and services.

Management Software: we develop management systems that facilitate the administration of users, teams, and permissions, ensuring easy management of resources.
fitp.text-9:
We are designers, front-end and back-end developers, mechanics, and engineers with experience in developing software, prototypes, and machines at a high innovative level.



Our goal

To make our skills available and enable the Client to see his or her Product developed and working in a short, precise, and agreed upon timeframe.
